quest.name: The Children of Azim
journal: Lyse would like very much to know that Hien and Gosetsu are all right.

Hien and Gosetsu finally emerge from Bardam's Mettle, triumphant and newly anointed as warriors of the Steppe like you and Lyse. But before you can rejoice in your accomplishment, you find yourself surrounded by a party of Oronir, their leader demanding that you return with him to meet with his khan. Hien considers this an opportunity to learn more of his foes and soon-to-be allies, and so you all agree to follow the Oronir to the Dawn Throne, where their khan awaits.

The most radiant brother Magnai, leader of the Oronir and lord of the Dawn Throne, recognizes you as warriors of the Steppe. But there his respect ends. He demands that you acknowledge his supreme authority and pay tribute, and when Lyse and Hien balk at his presumption, his flash of anger makes clear that it may be wiser to humor the Oronir...for now.

Magnai is pleased to see you step forward first, and states that there is much to be done in preparation for the Naadam. The details of the duties he would demand from you, however, shall be given by Baatu, the warrior who commanded your escort from Bardam's Mettle.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: You don't think they...no, of course not. Hien and Gosetsu will come out any minute now.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I suppose we could chat a little while we wait... Oh! So the other day, I said to Alisaie, I said...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I know, I know, I probably should've left the talking to everyone else...

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Pretentious and preening he may be, but doubt not that he is a warrior. You saw the axe by his throne...and the rage in his eyes.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Favor, tribute...how easily the language of tyrants tumbles from this khan's lips.

dialogue.name: BAATU
dialogue.text: You will conduct yourself with utmost propriety in Magnai's presence. Or face consequences.

dialogue.name: DAIDUKUL
dialogue.text: Hmm... Yes...yes... This one is special.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: So you are the first to step forward. Hmm. Bold...or reckless. I see why Daidukul favors you.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: ...Were I Buduga, I might take offense.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: But I know better than to dismiss a woman outright. You demonstrate boldness...or recklessness. Time will tell.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: The Naadam approaches, and the Oronir will reign supreme once more. Such is the will of Father Azim.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: Yet only fools think to triumph by the grace of the gods aloneâ”€and we are not fools.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: Your task will be to aid us in our preparations. Baatu will tell you the rest.

obj.n: In the Footsteps of Bardam the Brave
